sen.j: 竹田駅（たけだえき）は、京都府京都市伏見区にある、京都市営地下鉄と近畿日本鉄道の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, Takeda Station is a stop on Kyoto City Subway and on Kintetsu Railways.
Takeda Station, located in Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on Kyoto City Subway and Kintetsu Railways.
Takeda Station, located in Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on Kyoto Municipal Subway and Kintetsu Railways.

sen.j: 近鉄京都線と京都市営地下鉄烏丸線を直通運転する列車はこの駅から近鉄線・地下鉄線に入る。
sen.e: The trains providing through service between Kintetsu Kyoto Line and Karasuma Line of Kyoto City Subway enter the Kintetsu line or the subway line at this station.
The trains providing through-service between the Kintetsu Kyoto Line and the Karasuma Line of Kyoto City Subway enter either the Kintetsu Line or the subway line at this station.
The trains providing through-service between the Kintetsu Kyoto Line and the Karasuma Line of Kyoto Municipal Subway enter either the Kintetsu Line or the subway line at this station.

sen.j: なお、現在でこそ特急を除く全ての列車が停車する（一時期、近鉄京都線に設定されていた快速急行も停車していた）が、1988年に地下鉄京都市営地下鉄烏丸線が竹田駅まで開業するまでは普通列車しか停車しなかった。
sen.e: All trains except Limited ones stop at this station now (for a period of time, the Rapid Express trains once run on Kintetsu Kyoto Line also stopped at this station), but only Local trains stopped here until Karasuma Line of Kyoto City Subway started its operation in 1988

All trains except limited ones stop at this station now (for a period of time, the rapid express trains that ran on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line also stopped at this station), but only local trains stopped here until the Karasuma Line of Kyoto City Subway started operations in 1988.

All trains except limited express ones stop at this station now (for a period of time, the rapid express trains that ran on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line also stopped at this station), but only local trains stopped here until the Karasuma Line of Kyoto Municipal Subway started operations in 1988.

sen.j: 京都市営地下鉄
sen.e: Kyoto City Subway
Kyoto City Subway
Kyoto Municipal Subway

sen.j: 京都市営地下鉄烏丸線（駅番号：K15） ※終着駅であるが一部列車が近鉄線へ直通
sen.e: Karasuma Line of Kyoto City Subway (station number: K15): * This station is a terminal station of this line, but some trains on this line enter the Kintetsu line directly and run on the line as well.

The Karasuma Line of Kyoto City Subway (station number K15): * This station is a terminal station of this line, but some trains on this line enter the Kintetsu Line directly and run on the line as well.

The Karasuma Line of Kyoto City Subway (station number K15): * This station is a terminal station of this line, but some trains on this line enter the Kintetsu Line directly and run on the line as well.

sen.j: 近畿日本鉄道
sen.e: Kintetsu Railways
Kintetsu Railways
Kintetsu Railways

sen.j: 近鉄京都線
sen.e: Kintetsu Kyoto Line
Kintetsu Kyoto Line
Kintetsu Kyoto Line

sen.j: ホームは2面4線の島式ホームで、2・3番線は地下鉄烏丸線と相互直通運転の列車が、1・4番線は近鉄京都駅発着の列車が使用する。
sen.e: Island platforms, two platforms with each of them serving two tracks, are provided: Platform 2 and 3 are used by trains that provide through service with Karasuma Line of Kyoto City Subway, and Platform 1 and 4 by those coming from or going to Kintetsu Kyoto Station.

It has island platforms, and two platforms with each of them serving two tracks, are provided: tracks 2 and 3 are used by trains that provide through service with the Karasuma Line of Kyoto City Subway, and track 1 and 4 are used by those coming from or going to Kintetsu Kyoto Station.

It has two island platforms serving four tracks; Platform 2 and 3 are used by trains that provide through service with the Karasuma Line of Kyoto Municipal Subway, and Platform 1 and 4 are used by those coming from or going to Kintetsu Kyoto Station.
sen.cmt: 文頭の表現を修正しました。city →municipal としました。tracks 2 and 3→Platform 2 and 3に変更しました。track 1 and 4→Platform 1 and 4に変更しました。

sen.j: 同一方向であれば近鉄と地下鉄は同一ホームで乗換ができ、近鉄特急に乗車する場合を除いて京都駅での乗換よりはるかに便利である。
sen.e: You can change a train on the Kintetsu line to that on the subway or viceversa on the same platform of this station, by far easier than making a train change at the Kyoto station, except when getting on a Kintetsu Limited Express train.

You can change a train on the Kintetsu Line to that on the subway or vice versa on the same platform of this station, which is much easier than making a train change at Kyoto Station, except when getting on a Kintetsu limited express train.

You can change a train on the Kintetsu Line to that on the subway or vice versa on the same platform of this station, which is much easier than making a train change at Kyoto Station, except when getting on a Kintetsu limited express train.

sen.j: しかし、地下鉄の五条駅以北から近鉄で遠方に向かう乗客が、着席（座席確保）目的で敢えて京都駅で乗り換える様子も見られる。
sen.e: However, some passengers who are going to the north of Gojo Station on the Kintetsu line appear to change trains intentionally at the Kyoto station to secure their passenger seats.
However, some passengers who are going to the north of Gojo Station on the Kintetsu Line appear to change trains intentionally at Kyoto Station in order to secure their seats.

However, some passengers who come from the north of Gojo Station of the subway and go to a far destination using the Kintetsu Line appear to change trains intentionally at Kyoto Station in order to secure their seats.
sen.cmt: 原文の意味のように修正しました（五条駅以北から遠方に向かう、の箇所など）。

sen.j: 2・3番線の南方には2本分の引き上げ線がある。
sen.e: In the south of platforms 2 and 3, two side-tracks are provided.
In the south of platforms 2 and 3, two side tracks are provided.
In the south of Platform 2 and 3, two side tracks are provided.

sen.j: 2番線に到着した市営烏丸線の竹田止まりの車両は引き上げ線に入り、折り返して3番線に入線して国際会館行きとなる。
sen.e: A train bound for Takeda Station on Karasuma Line of Kyoto City Subway enters a side-track when arriving at track 2 of this station, changes its direction there and then enters track 3 as a train bound for Kokusaikaikan Station

A train bound for Takeda Station on the Karasuma Line of Kyoto City Subway enters a side track when arriving at track 2 of this station, changes its direction there and then enters track 3 as a train bound for Kokusaikaikan Station.

A train bound for Takeda Station on the Karasuma Line of Kyoto Municipal Subway enters a side track when arriving at Platform 2 of this station, changes its direction there and then enters Platform 3 as a train bound for Kokusaikaikan Station.

sen.j: 駅の北西に烏丸線の竹田車庫があり、2・3番線の北方で本線から分岐する入出庫線がある。
sen.e: The Takeda depot is provided in the north-west of Karasuma Station, and the tracks for entering/exiting the depot branch from the main tracks in the north of tracks 2 and 3.
The Takeda depot is provided in the northwest of Karasuma Station, and the tracks for entering/exiting the depot branch from the main tracks in the north of Platform 2 and 3.
The Takeda depot is provided in the northwest of Karasuma Station, and the tracks for entering/exiting the depot branch from the main tracks in the north of Platform 2 and 3.

sen.j: 駅舎は北側と南側の2箇所にあり、いずれも橋上駅である。
sen.e: Two station houses, one on the north side and the other on south side, are provided, each of which is an over-track station.
Two station houses, one on the north side and the other on south side, are provided, each of which is an over-track station.
Two station houses, one on the north side and the other on south side, are provided, each of which is an over-track station.

sen.j: また、北駅舎のすぐ南側を名神高速道路がオーバークロスしている。
sen.e: The Meishin Expressway road runs over the railway tracks immediately on the south side of the north-side station house.
The Meishin Expressway runs over the railway tracks immediately on the south side of the north side station house.
The Meishin Expressway runs over the railway tracks immediately on the south side of the north side station house.

sen.j: 自動改札機はオムロン製が設置されている。
sen.e: Automatic ticket gates from OMRON are installed.
The automatic ticket gates were manufactured by OMRON.
The automatic ticket gates were manufactured by OMRON.

sen.j: 京都市交通局と近鉄の共同使用駅であるこの駅は、京都市交通局の管轄駅となっている（相互直通開始前は近鉄の管轄駅であった）。
sen.e: This station, used by both Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau and Kintetsu, is under control of Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau (it was Kintetsu that controlled this station before the through service operation statrted).

This station, used by both the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau and Kintetsu, is under the control of the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau (but Kintetsu controlled this station before the through-service operation started).

This station, used by both the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau and Kintetsu, is under the control of the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau (but Kintetsu controlled this station before the through-service operation started).

sen.j: その関係上、自動改札機等の設備は京都市営地下鉄仕様となっており、Jスルーはそのまま自動改札機に通すことができない。
sen.e: Therefore, the specifications of the equipment, such as automatic ticket gates, are those for Kyoto City Subway, and J-through cards cannot be used for the automatic ticket gates directly.
Therefore, the specifications of the equipment, such as automatic ticket gates, are those for Kyoto City Subway, and J-through cards can't be used directly for the automatic ticket gates.
Therefore, the specifications of the equipment, such as automatic ticket gates, are those for Kyoto Municipal Subway, and J-through cards can't be used directly for the automatic ticket gates.

sen.j: Jスルーカードを利用する際は、降車時は自動精算機にカードを通す必要があり、乗車時は予め自動券売機で切符に引き換えることになる。
sen.e: When a J-through card is to be used, the card must be inserted into a fare adjustment machine when exiting throguh one of the gates and a train ticket must be purchased with an automatic ticket vending machine using the card.

When a J-through card is to be used, the card must be inserted into a fare-adjustment machine when exiting through one of the gates; a train ticket must be purchased with an automatic ticket vending machine using the card.

When a J-through card is to be used, the card must be inserted into a fare-adjustment machine when exiting through one of the gates; a train ticket must be purchased with an automatic ticket vending machine using the card.

sen.j: スルッとKANSAI対応カードは両社局で共通利用が出来るため、そのまま自動改札機を通すことができる。
sen.e: Being usable both on the subwasy and Kintetus lines, cards supporting KANSAI THRU PASS can be used for the automatic ticket gates
Being usable both on the subway and Kintetsu Lines, cards supporting KANSAI THRU PASS can be used for the automatic ticket gates.
Being usable both on the subway and Kintetsu Lines, cards supporting KANSAI THRU PASS can be used for the automatic ticket gates.

sen.j: その他の施設や案内および駅名標も、基本的には地下鉄仕様となっているが、近鉄線ホーム（1・4番線）の列車案内ソラリーは近鉄仕様のものを使用しており（外観の色は異なる）、アナウンスも近鉄仕様となっている。
sen.e: The specifications of other facilities, guide signs and the design of the station name boards are also basically those for Kyoto City Subway, but Solary-type ("Solary" is tentative, because it is a human name but its correct spelling is unknown) train information display based on Kintetus specifications are used on platforms for the Kintetsu line (for tracks 1 and 4) (the exterior color is changed), with Kintetus specifications also used for the announcements.

The specifications of other facilities, guide signs and the design of the station name boards are also basically those for Kyoto City Subway, but Solari-type train-information display based on Kintetsu specifications are used on platforms for the Kintetsu Line (for tracks 1 and 4) (the exterior color is changed), and the announcements are also made according to Kintetsu specifications.

The specifications of other facilities, guide signs and the design of the station name boards are also basically those for Kyoto Municipal Subway, but Solari-type train-information display based on Kintetsu specifications are used on platforms for the Kintetsu Line (for Platforms 1 and 4) (the exterior color is changed), and the announcements are also made according to Kintetsu specifications.

sen.j: また、2番線からの地下鉄→近鉄の直通列車発車時には、地下鉄仕様のアナウンスに近鉄仕様の発車ブザーである。
sen.e: When a through service train, running from the subway to the Kintetsu line, departs from track 2, an announment based on specifications of the subway is made but the buzzer used for the departure is made based on Kintetsu specifications.

When a through-service train, running from the subway to the Kintetsu Line, departs from track 2, an announcement based on specifications of the subway is made but the buzzer used for the departure is made based on Kintetsu specifications.

When a through-service train, running from the subway to the Kintetsu Line, departs from Platform 2, an announcement based on specifications of the subway is made but the buzzer used for the departure is made based on Kintetsu specifications.

sen.j: 近鉄奈良駅ゆきの電車は、1番線の列車案内では「奈良」、2番線では「近鉄奈良」と表記される（電車の方向幕は近鉄車・地下鉄車とも「奈良」）。
sen.e: For trains for Kintetsu Nara Station, the train information display board for track 1 displays "Nara" but that for track 2 "Kintetsu Nara" (both subway trains and Kintetsu trains equally use "Nara" for their destination-indicating displays).

For trains for Kintetsu Nara Station, the train-information display board for track 1 displays "Nara" but that for track 2 indicates "Kintetsu Nara" (both subway trains and Kintetsu trains equally use "Nara" for their destination displays).

For trains for Kintetsu Nara Station, the train-information display board for Platform 1 displays 'Nara' but that for Platform 2 indicates 'Kintetsu Nara' (both subway trains and Kintetsu trains equally use 'Nara' for the destination blind).
sen.cmt: 方向幕 の表現を変更しました。

sen.j: なお、地下鉄烏丸線・近鉄京都線とも京都駅を経由するが、当駅からの各社局の京都駅までの運賃は異なる（2008年4月時点では近鉄京都駅の方が安い）。
sen.e: Both Karasuma Line of Kyoto City Subway and Kintetsu Kyoto Line operate their trains via Kyoto Station, but the train fare from this station to the Kyoto station on the subway and that on the Kintetsu line are different (as of April of 2004, the fare on Kintetsu Kyoto Line is lower-priced).

Both the Karasuma Line of Kyoto City Subway and the Kintetsu Kyoto Line operate their trains via Kyoto Station, but the train fare from this station to Kyoto Station on the subway and that on the Kintetsu Line are different (as of April 2004, the fare on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line is lower).

Both the Karasuma Line of Kyoto Municipal Subway and the Kintetsu Kyoto Line operate their trains via Kyoto Station, but the train fare from this station to Kyoto Station on the subway and that on the Kintetsu Line are different (as of April 2004, the fare on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line is lower).

sen.j: 当駅以南から京都駅まで向かう場合にも両社の運賃の不整合が生じており、近鉄京都駅までの乗車券で地下鉄京都駅で下車しようとすると追加運賃が生じる（ちなみに京都市営地下鉄においてはこの他、京都市営地下鉄東西線山科駅・京阪京津線京阪山科駅において、直通運転対象との運賃不整合問題がある）。
sen.e: The train fares for Kyoto Station from stations in the south of this station on one of the subway and Kintetsu lines are different from those of the other, and when you exit through a gate at the subway Kyoto station with a tiket for the Kintetsu Kyoto station, you are required to pay an additional fare (on the Kyoto City Subway lines, train fare inconsistency also exists for the through service operation at Yamashina Station on Tozai Line of subway/Keihan Yamashina Station on Keihan Keishin Line).

The train fares for Kyoto Station from stations in the south of this station differ from those for the subway and Kintetsu lines, and when you exit through a gate at the subway Kyoto station with a ticket for the Kintetsu Kyoto station, you are required to pay an additional fare (on the Kyoto City Subway lines, train fare inconsistency also exists for the through-service operation at Yamashina Station on the Tozai Line of the subway and/or the Keihan Yamashina Station on the Keihan Keishin Line).

The train fares for Kyoto Station from stations in the south of this station differ from those for the subway and Kintetsu lines, and when you exit through a gate at the subway Kyoto station with a ticket for the Kintetsu Kyoto station, you are required to pay an additional fare (on the Kyoto Municipal Subway lines, train fare inconsistency also exists for the through-service operation at Yamashina Station on the Tozai Line of the subway and/or the Keihan Yamashina Station on the Keihan Keishin Line).

sen.j: なお、その回避策として、地下鉄線列車の当駅発車前に、運賃に関する車内アナウンスが放送されている。
sen.e: To avoid problems concerned with this situation, an announcement for the fare is made within the subway trains concerned when they depart from this station.
To avoid problems concerned with this situation, fare announcements are made within the subway trains concerned when they depart from this station.
To avoid problems concerned with this situation, fare announcements are made within the subway trains concerned when they depart from this station.

sen.e: Kyoto City Subway
Kyoto City Subway

sen.j: 2005年度の1日平均乗降客数は 47,104人（近鉄京都線直通利用客を含む）。
sen.e: The number of passengers using this station a day is 47,104 in the fiscal 2005 (including those using the through service to Kintetsu Kyoto Line).
In fiscal 2005, the daily number of passengers using this station was 47,104 (including those using the through-service to the Kintetsu Kyoto Line).
In fiscal year 2005, the daily number of passengers using this station was 47,104 (including those using the through-service to the Kintetsu Kyoto Line).
sen.cmt: fiscal → fiscal yearに変更しました。

sen.j: 2005年11月8日の調査結果によると、1日の乗降客は11454人。
sen.e: According to a servey on November 8, 2005, the number of passengers using this station a day is 11,454.
According to a survey conducted on November 8, 2005, a total of 11,454 passengers used this station.
According to a survey conducted on November 8, 2005, a total of 11,454 passengers used this station.

sen.j: 近鉄の全調査対象駅（323駅、但し調査当時の数）中、68位。
sen.e: This number is the 68th of all stations on Kintetsu lines surveyed (323 stations, as of when the surveywas made).
This number makes the facility sixty-eighth among all Kintetsu Line stations surveyed (323 stations, as of when the survey was conducted).
This number makes the facility sixty-eighth among all Kintetsu Line stations surveyed (323 stations, as of when the survey was conducted).

sen.j: 京都線の駅（26駅、大和西大寺駅含む）の中では、12位。
sen.e: Of the stations on the Kyoto line (including Saidaiji Station), this station is placed at the 12th.
Of the stations on the Kyoto Line (including Saidaiji Station), this station ranked twelfth.
Of the stations on the Kyoto Line (twenty-six stations including Yamato-Saidaiji Station), this station ranked twelfth.

sen.j: 京都府内の近鉄の駅（23駅）の中では、10位。

sen.e: The nearest stops are Takeda Station Higashiguchi (east entrance), located in the traffic circle at the east entrance to Takeda Station, and Takeda Station Nishiguchi (west entrance), located in the traffic circle at the west entrance to Takeda Station.

The nearest stops are Takeda Station Higashiguchi (east entrance), located in the traffic circle at the east entrance to Takeda Station, and Takeda Station Nishiguchi (west entrance), located in the traffic circle at the west entrance to Takeda Station.

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）11月15日 奈良電気鉄道京都～桃山御陵前駅間開通時に城南宮前駅として開業。
sen.e: This station started its operation as Jonangumae Station on November 15, 1928, when Nara Electric Railway started its operation between Kyoto and Momoyamagoryomae Station.
This station went into operation as Jonangumae Station on November 15, 1928, when Nara Electric Railway started between Kyoto and Momoyamagoryomae Station.
November 15, 1928: This station went into operation as Jonangumae Station when Nara Electric Railway started between Kyoto and Momoyamagoryomae Station.

sen.j: 現在の竹田駅より、約350m南にあった。
sen.e: This initial station was located in approx. 350-m south of the present Takeda station.
This initial facility was located approximately 350 meters south of the present Takeda Station.
This initial facility was located approximately 350 meters south of the present Takeda Station.

sen.j: 1940年（昭和15年）4月1日 竹田駅に改称。
sen.e: Its name was changed to Takeda Station on April 1, 1940.
Its name was changed to Takeda Station on April 1, 1940.
April 1, 1940: Its name was changed to Takeda Station.

sen.j: 1963年（昭和38年）10月1日 奈良電気鉄道が近畿日本鉄道に合併される。
sen.e: On December 1, 1963, Nara Electric Railway was merged into Kintetsu Corporation.
On December 1, 1963, Nara Electric Railway was merged into Kintetsu Corporation.
October 1, 1963: Nara Electric Railway was merged into Kintetsu Corporation.

sen.j: 1988年（昭和63年）6月11日 京都市営地下鉄烏丸線（京都～竹田間）の延伸開業に伴い、旧駅舎より約350m北側の現在地に移転。
sen.e: On June 11, 1988, when Kyoto City Subway opened Karasuma Line (between Kyoto and Takeda) extending its line, the station house was moved to the presnet site, approx. 350-north of the former site.

On June 11, 1988, when Kyoto City Subway opened the Karasuma Line (between Kyoto and Takeda) extending its line, the station house was moved to the present site, approximately 350 meters north of the former site.

June 11, 1988: When Kyoto Municipal Subway opened the Karasuma Line (between Kyoto and Takeda) extending its line, the station house was moved to the present site, approximately 350 meters north of the former site.
sen.cmt: city →municipal としました。日付表記変更

sen.j: 京都市営地下鉄管轄駅になる。
sen.e: Since then, this station is under control of Kyoto City Subway.
Since then, this station has been under the control of Kyoto City Subway.
Since then, this station has been under the control of Kyoto Municipal Subway.

sen.j: 近鉄京都線の急行・準急停車駅に昇格。
sen.e: The status of this station on Kintetsu Kyoto Line has been raised to that of the station where express trains and semi-express trains stop.
The status of this station on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line has been raised to that of the station where express trains and semi-express trains stop.
The status of this station on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line has been raised to that of the station where express trains and semi-express trains stop.

sen.j: 1988年（昭和63年）8月28日 近鉄京都線と京都市営地下鉄烏丸線の間で相互直通運転を開始。
sen.e: On August28, 1988, Kintetsu Kyoto Line and Karasuma Line of Kyoto City Subway started through service between them.
On August 28, 1988, the Kintetsu Kyoto Line and the Karasuma Line of Kyoto City Subway started through-service between their respective lines.
August 28, 1988: The Kintetsu Kyoto Line and the Karasuma Line of Kyoto Municipal Subway started through-service between their respective lines.
sen.cmt: city →municipal としました。日付表記変更

sen.j: 1998年（平成10年）3月17日 同日のダイヤ変更で新設された近鉄京都線の快速急行の停車駅となる。
sen.e: On March 17, 1998, when the train schedule was changed and the rapid-express train service was introduced on Kintetsu Kyoto Line, this station was selected as the one where such trains stopped.

On March 17, 1998, when the train schedule was changed and the rapid-express train service was introduced on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line, this station was selected as the one where such trains would stop.
March 17, 1998: When the train schedule was changed and the rapid-express train service was introduced on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line, this station was selected as the one where such trains would stop.

sen.j: 2000年（平成12年）3月15日 烏丸線国際会館～近鉄奈良間直通の急行を運転開始。
sen.e: On March 15, 2000, through service of express trains started between Kokusaikaikan Station on Karasuma Line and Kintetsu Nara Station.
On March 15, 2000, the through-service of express trains was launched between Kokusaikaikan Station on the Karasuma Line and Kintetsu Nara Station.
March 15, 2000: The through-service of express trains was launched between Kokusaikaikan Station on the Karasuma Line and Kintetsu Nara Station.

sen.j: 2003年（平成15年）3月6日 同日のダイヤ変更により近鉄京都線の快速急行廃止。
sen.e: On March 6, 2003, when the train schedule was changed, the operation of rapid-express trains on Kintetsu Kyoto Line was abolished.
On March 6, 2003, when the train schedule was changed, the operation of rapid-express trains on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line was abolished.
March 6, 2003: When the train schedule was changed, the operation of rapid-express trains on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line was abolished.

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）4月1日 PiTaPa使用開始。
sen.e: On April 1, 2007, use of PiTaPa started.
On April 1, 2007, PiTaPa came into use.
April 1, 2007: PiTaPa came into use.

tit.j: 乗り入れ車両について

sen.j: 京都市営地下鉄烏丸線の車両は京都市交通局所有（京都市交通局10系電車）と近鉄所有（近鉄3200系電車、近鉄3220系電車）の2種類3形式があり簡単に区別できる。
sen.e: The train cars used on Karasuma Lin of Kyto City Subway are those owned by Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau (Kyoto Municipal Subway Series 10 train cars) and those owned by Kintetus (Kintetsu (Railways) series 3200 train cars) and Kintetus (Kintetsu (Railways) series 3220 train cars), and they can be differentiated easily.

The train cars used on the Karasuma Line of Kyoto City Subway are those owned by the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau (Kyoto Municipal Subway Series 10 train cars) and those owned by Kintetsu (Kintetsu (Railways) Series 3200 train cars) and Kintetsu (Kintetsu (Railways) Series 3220 train cars), and they are easily differentiated.

The train cars used on the Karasuma Line of Kyoto Municipal Subway are those owned by the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau (Kyoto Municipal Subway Series 10 train cars) and those owned by Kintetsu (Kintetsu Series 3200 and 3220 train cars), and they are easily differentiated.
sen.cmt: 近鉄電車の表現を「Kintetsu Series ～」と変更しました。

sen.j: 近鉄所有の車両（3200系、3220系）は近鉄京都駅発着の列車にも使用されている。
sen.e: Train cars owned by Kintetsu (sereis 3200 and series 3220) are also used for those starting running at and returning to Kintetsu Kyoto Station.
The train cars owned by Kintetsu (Series 3200 and Series 3220) are also used for those starting at and returning to Kintetsu Kyoto Station.
The train cars owned by Kintetsu (Series 3200 and Series 3220) are also used for those starting at and returning to Kintetsu Kyoto Station.

sen.j: そのうち、3220系の2本は奈良・京都のペイント列車である。
sen.e: Of them, two trains of the 3220 series cars have been painted.
Of them, two trains of the 3220 series cars have been painted.
Of them, two trains of the 3220 series cars have been painted to commemorate the through-service between Kyoto and Nara.
sen.cmt: ペイント列車の補足をしました。

sen.j: 近鉄京都・国際会館方面行きの近鉄3200系、3220系車両は、地下鉄烏丸線に入る列車と近鉄京都行きの列車の両方。
sen.e: The series 3200 train cars and series 3220 ones bound for Kokusaikaikan Station on Kintetsu Kyoto Line enter Karasuma Line of the subwasy or are for Kintetsu Kyoto Station.
The Series 3200 cars and Series 3220 cars bound for Kokusaikaikan Station on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line enter the Karasuma Line of the subway or are for Kintetsu Kyoto Station.
The Series 3200 cars and Series 3220 cars bound for Kokusaikaikan Station on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line enter the Karasuma Line of the subway or are for Kintetsu Kyoto Station.

sen.j: また国際会館方面行きの急行については、当駅で車両の行先表示が「急行 京都国際会館」から「国際会館」（種別表記なし。
sen.e: On the express trains bound for Kokusaikaikan Station, the destination display is changed from Kyoto Kokusaikaikan to Kokusaikaikan (no operation type is displayed).
On the express trains bound for Kokusaikaikan Station, the destination display is changed from Kyoto Kokusaikaikan to Kokusaikaikan (no operation type is displayed).
On the express trains bound for Kokusaikaikan Station, the destination display is changed from 'Express Kokusaikaikan' to 'Kokusaikaikan' (no operation type is displayed).

sen.j: 3200系の場合種別幕は黒幕）に代わる。
sen.e: On the 3200 series train cars, the background of the type display becomes black.)
On the 3200 Series train cars, the background of the type display becomes black.
On the 3200 Series train cars, the background of the type display becomes black.
